poem.title: Belvedere
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Lob
The sun high
And a narrow arch
Beyond which
As in a pond
She watches
Apollo Belvedere
His bow and laurel sprig.

A face glimpsed in a crowd
Can get Bernini'd in me,
Figured like Chipangu
By cartographers to the pope.

Clear brow, and from the bridge
A steep, narrow ridge down
To two commas.
Straight, retentive mouth and eyes.

There
Is a face
That may become
A map on vellum and bone
Of forgotten countries.
